title: Tesla loses two top executives at energy unit - Bloomberg
text:
May 15, 2018 / 9:27 PM / Updated 8 minutes ago Tesla loses two top executives at energy unit - Bloomberg Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
(Reuters) - Tesla Inc’s ( TSLA.O ) energy unit has lost two major executives, Bloomberg reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter. FILE PHOTO: A man looks at a Tesla Model S car at its showroom in Beijing, China January 29, 2014. REUTERS/Kim Kyung-Hoon/File Photo
Arch Padmanabhan, the product director for Tesla’s stationary storage unit, and Bob Rudd, a former SolarCity vice president who led North American commercial and utility sales, have both left the company, according to the report. Related Coverage
Tesla declined to comment on the report.
Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk told employees on Monday that the company was undergoing a “thorough reorganization”.
Tesla has seen a flurry of senior executive exits in recent months at a time when the company is looking to ramp up production of its Model 3 sedan. Reporting by Munsif Vengattil in Bengaluru; Editing by Sriraj Kalluvila
